title: Solving Avrdude Communication Error (Try these in order)

fields.value: If serial monitor is open, close it.
Try changing the port you are connecting and selecting it from software, you can find it in tools -> port.

Check if the power led on your board lights up. If it's on unplug and re-plug your board. Now check for blinking leds. If only power or no led lights up ask for further assistance. (not for all boards)
If you have a Nano or other 328p based board try using the old bootloader. Go to tools -> processor and select 328p(old bootloader). If your board doesn't have a 328p chip, you can skip this step.

Try pressing reset button on arduino, if when you reset the onboard led doesn't blink, you probably have a broken bootloader, you can check [this tutorial](https://www.arduino.cc/en/Hacking/Bootloader?from=Tutorial.Bootloader) for how to burn bootloader.
If there's anything connected to Tx and Rx pins, try removing everything attached to them.
This might just be a communication problem or your computer getting confused so try restarting your computer.

Check your drivers, sometimes just reinstalling them works. If you are using a clone board you might have CH340 communication chip, which isn't supported for Uno. You can check that by looking at your board and checking a chip's name (not the big one). [Click here](https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/how-to-install-ch340-drivers/all) for installing CH340 chip. If you don't have CH340 chip you can try installing drivers from Windows device manager.
You can try checking [this website](https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/how-to-install-ftdi-drivers/windows---in-depth) for your drivers.
Last thing might be Arduino IDE's problem. If you think that's the case try reinstalling Arduino IDE.
